Transcript:
Livvie's voice: Hi, this is Livvie. 
Leave a message.
[Answering machine beeps]

Tess: Stop staying that, Livvie. I 
don't want to leave a message. Something is very wrong. You have to be careful. 
Answer me, Livvie, please.

Livvie: Come on, Caleb, I'm waiting 
for you.
Joshua: Hello, Livvie.

Livvie: What do you want? Where's 
Caleb?
Joshua: Oh, he's not coming.

Livvie: Come on, don't be ridiculous. 
You said he wanted me to meet him down here by the docks.

Joshua: No, that's because I needed 
you to be here.
Livvie: Why?

Joshua: Well, let's see. It's 
secluded. There's nobody else around. Oh, yeah -- you can't swim.

Stephen: You are dead to me now. I 
will get over you. I'll find a way. I'll find a way.
Ian: Let's not do this, not today.

Kevin: 
The longer you drag out this high school crush you have on my wife, the more 
pathetic you look. Ian, it's embarrassing.
Ian: What are you rambling about?

Kevin: You playing the martyr, when 
all you're really doing is trying to manipulate my wife against me.

Ian: You don't really need my help 
with that, though, do you?

Kevin: Let me put it this way -- you 
come after what's mine again, and you may be joining Eve a lot sooner than you 
think.
Ian: You're twisted.

Elizabeth: So, honey, you are 
breathtaking.
Jack: Unbelievable.

Rafe: I got to say that Rafe is very, 
very, very, very, very lucky.

Alison: Now, don't because you're 
going to make me cry, and I'm going to be mad at you because I'm going to ruin 
my mascara.

Jack: Ok. Ok. We will see you out 
front.
Alison: Ok.
Jamal: Good luck.
Alison: Thanks.

Jamal: Go on, girl, with your bad 
self. Love you.
Alison: Love you.
Amanda: Oh, my --
Alison: Do you approve?

Amanda: I couldn't be happier. Oh, 
dear, I only wish you -- your father would've loved it if he had only had his 
choice.
Elizabeth: She's right, honey.

Alison: Thank you, both of you. But 
now I have you guys here. I have you, Nana, and you, mother. I can't tell you 
how much I appreciate you guys making this so perfect for me today.

Amanda: Oh, darling, you deserve 
perfect.

Elizabeth: Stephen should've been here 
by now.

Alison: I'm sure that he'll be here 
very soon.

Amanda: Is that your only matter of 
concern? Today is a special day.

Alison: 
I wanted to show you guys this bracelet. It's very special. It was Rafe's 
mother's. It's my something old.
Amanda: Oh, isn't that lovely.

Alison: Isn't that pretty? I love it. 
It means so much to me to have it on. She would've really have loved to have 
been here to see her son get married.

Lucy: Oh, boy, you know something? I 
always knew you were handsome, but, in this tux, you are absolutely gorgeous. 
You are.
Rafe: Really?

Lucy: Yeah, really. Oh, wait a minute, 
one more thing -- there. You know, only blood relatives can do that.

Rafe: Yeah. You know, I guess I forgot 
to tell you, I thank God he made us family. You're the best, Luce.

Lucy: So are you, cousin. You know 
what today's about? Today is you making all this wonderful, brand-new kind of 
magic. You are getting married to Alison, and you know what? You two are more 
destined to be together than anybody I know.
Rafe: Yeah, I just wish that --

Lucy: No. Uh-uh. We're not going 
there. Don't talk about cCaleb. Let's not even say his name. We will get him, I 
promise you, but today is about you and Alison, and he's not going to steal 
that, and nobody is going to steal your happiness today, ok?

[Captioning made possible by abc, 
inc., And soapnet]
[music plays]

Chris: Dr. Collins, good to see you're 
a free man.

Kevin: 
Thank you, Ramsey.

Chris: Of course, I won't be referring 
any patients to you anytime soon, but, still, good to see you up and about.
Kevin: Thank you for your support.

Frank: You know, it seems like we've 
been to more weddings in this town, but as far as I'm concerned, there's only 
one I really care about.
Karen: Oh, and what would that be?

Frank: The one when everyone else is 
down here, and you and me are up there.

Karen: Well, you know, weddings can be 
so beautiful, but there is something to be said about eloping and saving all 
that energy for the honeymoon.
Jamal: Hey.
Ricky: Hey.
Reese: Imagine that.
Ricky: What?
Reese: People I actually know.

Ricky: Yeah. Stick with me, baby. 
Stick with me.
Jamal: Mr. Rock 'n' roll himself.

Jack: I don't know who he thinks he 
is. Think it's going to his head?

Jamal: No, no, of course not. It 
wouldn't do that.

Marissa: Ooh! Ok, you know what? 
Definitely the best-looking bridesmaid I have ever seen.

Jack: Hello, miss. You want to look 
this way?
Marissa: Oh, ok.
Jack: Give me some credit.

Marissa: 
You're cute. Definitely very, very cute, but Jamal wins hands down.
Jack: Oh, come on.
Marissa: Yes.

Jack: I can see this whole contest is 
rigged. Anyway, Marissa, where did you -- where did you put Tess?

Marissa: Oh, you know what, Jack? I 
went by the house, and she wasn't there.

Jack: Right, right. Well, maybe she 
got another ride.
Marissa: Probably.
Jack: I'm going to go check --

Jamal: Hey, hey, don't disappear, 
dude. We got the fireworks starting in a little bit.

Jack: I know, I'll be right back. I'm 
going to go get her.
Marissa: Ok.
Jamal: Hey -- uh-uh --
Marissa: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa --

Jamal: Hey, don't go anywhere. You're 
looking kind of hot yourself, baby. Whassup?

Marissa: Thank you. You know what? I 
was wondering something. Is this kind of weird for you?
Jamal: What?

Marissa: You know, once upon a time 
ago, you -- you would've been the one marrying Alison.

Jamal: Uh, yeah. Yeah, I kind of 
thought about that. Then I thought about how fate, luck, and God kind of somehow 
put us where we're supposed to be.

Marissa: I like that. Mind if I steal 
that for a song?

Jamal: Do anything you want to do, 
baby.
[Marissa chuckles]
Lucy: You look gorgeous.
Rafe: Hey, anyone here yet?

Ian: Yeah, it's filling up. You look 
quite the groom there, boy.

Rafe: Well, Lucy's keeping me 
together.
Ian: She's good at that.
Lucy: I should go.
Rafe: No, no, no, please, don't.

Ian: Don't leave on my account. You 
got your rings?
Rafe: Me?
Ian: Yeah.
Rafe: Oh, yeah, I got -- yeah, here.
Ian: Got your vows?
Rafe: Um -- yeah, they're right here.

Ian: Good. Relax. Means you don't need 
me. I'll see you in a bit.

Rafe: No, no, no. What, are you 
kidding me? You're the doctor. You've got to tell me why my heart feels like 
it's about collide with my stomach and leave my body altogether. That is, if my 
knees don't fail me first.

Ian: Well, you're about to tie the 
knot. It's a tough thing. Marriage is a tough thing. My old man used to call it 
the ball and chain. But then, you should've seen him looking at my mother for 
all these years. Truth be told, there's a lot of love in this world, but it's 
rare when it all falls into place. Isn't that right, Mrs. Collins?

Lucy: Yes, it's a very rare thing, 
indeed.

Ian: Well, I'm -- I'm not really 
romantic anymore, you know, but I used to think that love is -- is like a 
brand-new poem. In your own head, it's perfect. The hard part's making it come 
alive in somebody else. But if you find your soul mate, and you're lucky enough 
for her to recognize you, then you're truly blessed. Don't waste a moment of 
that, ok?
Rafe: Yeah, I hear you. Thanks, man.
Ian: All right.

Rafe: 
Hey, tell me something. Do you have to be Irish to come up with words like that?

Ian: Words and whiskey, that's my 
island.
Rafe: Yeah.

Lucy: I heard you. What you said was 
beautiful.

Alison: My something old is the 
locket. My something new is my dress. My something borrowed is Nana's hankie.

Amanda: Yeah. I carried it at my own 
wedding.

Alison: That's why it makes it that 
much more special to me. And my something blue is my garter. So I'm done.

Amanda: I'm so pleased with the 
florist. I knew that the roses that she picked was the right choice. Lilies are 
so commonplace.

Elizabeth: No, I said calla lilies, 
and they're divine.

Alison: You guys, are we honestly 
still talking about flowers?

Elizabeth: No, no, no, no. No, no. I 
think that, for this day, your grandmother and I can agree to get along.

Alison: Good. That would mean so much 
to me. You have no idea because Rafe and I, we promised each other that we would 
only focus on our wedding and each other for the entire day.

Elizabeth: That's exactly how it 
should be. Sweetie, just being here with you makes this just as perfect as it 
can be.
Stephen: I'm not interrupting, am I?

Elizabeth: 
Oh, you're here.

Stephen: You look ravishing, all of 
you. Alison, you have great taste.
Alison: Thank you.

Stephen: And I know exactly where you 
get it.

Elizabeth: Sweetheart, will you excuse 
me just for a minute?
Alison: No, go ahead.
Stephen: Hey. You look upset.
Elizabeth: Oh, you have no idea.
Stephen: You need water?

Elizabeth: No! No, Stephen, I can't do 
this. I just -- oh, I can't even barely hold myself together in there.

Stephen: Look, it's a very emotional 
day for you.

Elizabeth: No, you've got to stop 
this, ok? I don't want to be a vampire.

Stephen: Calm down, and tell me what 
happened.

Elizabeth: I can't even control this. 
It's completely permeated my senses. It's just -- my skin is burning. I can feel 
it rushing in my veins!

Stephen: It can be very intoxicating, 
if you allow it to be.

Elizabeth: I almost bit Alison, my own 
daughter! I wanted to.

Stephen: Shh. Those are silly, silly 
thoughts. You couldn't bite her. You can't feed on a blood relative. You see? 
There's nothing to be upset about. You're never going to hurt Alison, not ever.
Elizabeth: No, you don't understand --

Stephen: I -- I do understand. I was 
afraid once, too. Until I learned to live with it. Until I learned that most 
people 
live their entire lives never understanding their own senses -- how touch can 
feel like electric current, how the scent of a flower is absorbed into every 
pore, how the sound of a song can fill your soul.

Elizabeth: Then why is it so 
frightening?

Stephen: Because it's bigger than 
anything you ever imagined. You're going to end up asking yourself, "how can 
this be real?" And you're going to wonder how that pathetic little existence you 
had before, you could even call it a life. This is ours for eternity, and we 
haven't even scratched the surface yet, baby. Just think what could happen if we 
explore this together.
Elizabeth: I don't know how.

Stephen: 
I'm gong to show you how. Hey, when the wedding's over, let's go away, just the 
two of us. You pick the place, I'll take care of everything, but most important, 
i'm going to take care of you.
Elizabeth: Ohh. Do you mean that?

Stephen: Of course I do. Because I 
know your heart. And it's the right heart for me. Come here.
Elizabeth: Mmm.

Livvie: I don't know what you're 
trying to prove, but I guarantee you Caleb wouldn't like it.

Joshua: You know, sometimes Caleb 
doesn't know what's in his best interests. I'm afraid this is one of those 
times.

Livvie: That's absurd. Who died and 
left you boss?
Joshua: Hopefully -- you.
Livvie: Why? What have I done?

Joshua: What have you not done? You 
betrayed him. You tried to kill him. You distract him from his important work. 
You've done things you don't even know about.
Livvie: But I love him.
Joshua: "Love"? Don't make me laugh.

Livvie: Look, I'm through hurting him. 
I just want him to love me back, ok?

Joshua: 
You're his poison. You'll destroy everything he and I have created. I won't let 
that happen.

Livvie: All I want is for Caleb to be 
mine. That's it.
Joshua: Not in this lifetime. Aah!
[Music plays]
Jamal: What happened?
Jack: Oh, man, Tess still isn't here.

Jamal: Ok, look, we'll deal with it in 
a minute. Let's just handle this first. All right?
Lucy: Are you ok?

Rafe: 
I'm going to ignore him, and I want you to do the same thing.

Lucy: Yeah, but he -- ok, I'm going to 
ignore him. Right, right, that's what -- I'm a good ignorer, and I'm going to do 
that right now. Look at me. I'm ignoring him. Oh, I can't -- ok.

Amanda: Thank you for asking me to 
give you away. I hope you'll always be happy.

Alison: Thank you, Nana. And thank 
you, mom.

Elizabeth: Oh, we've gotten close 
enough that you called -- you called me "mom." I love you, baby.
Alison: Whoo.
Elizabeth: Whoo.
Alison: Ok.

Amanda: It's time to go, Alison. It's 
time to go.
Elizabeth: She's right. Are you ready?

Alison: Yeah. I've never been so 
ready.

Alison's voice: What's behind your 
back?

Rafe's voice: It's for you. But, see, 
the thing is, it's not exactly what I would have --
Alison's voice: It's perfect.

Alison: Oh, my God. I need to get to 
Rafe.
Joshua: Yes, yes --
Tess: No! No! No!
Livvie: Tess? Tess? Tess, is that you?
Tess: Help me!
Livvie: Tess!
Tess: Livvie!

Livvie: Tess, here, grab my hand. Grab 
it.
Tess: Oh -- oh, no.
Livvie: I've got you. Ok.
[Livvie screams]

Joshua: Well, well. Two for the price 
of one, what good fortune. Good-bye, Livvie. Good-bye, Tess. Caleb is well rid 
of both of you.
[Music plays]
Lucy: It's going to be ok.

Rafe: So, tell me, what's holding this 
up?

Lucy: Uh, don't know. But you know 
what? You know these things -- they can tend to take a little bit of time, I 
guess.
Elizabeth: Rafe! Rafe.

Rafe: What happened? What is it? 
What's going on?

Elizabeth: I'm not sure. Alison was 
all set to go, and --

Rafe: 
What? What? What?

Elizabeth: She pulled this out of her 
bouquet. She wants you to wear it for some reason.

Rafe: Tell her I love her. Ok. Now 
we're really ready.

All: Aww. (Christina walks down the 
aisle)

Woman: So cute. So precious. How 
adorable.

Lucy: Come here. Oh, you did terrific. 
Did you get them all out there?
>> On the next "Port Charles" --
Amanda: It's time, darling.

Kevin: Well, I hope you're not talking 
about me. And isn't that my wife you're holding?
Livvie: Please, help me.
Stephen: Olivia!
